Title: Dairy
Bio: Get the benefits of animal protein without the need to kill animals. Traditional benefits of animal based foods being Fat, Vitamin A, Vitamin B2, Vitamin B12, Calcium, Phosphorus, Selenium, Zinc, and Protein. Very different uses and places in recipes. Low variations as there are seperate cheese and milk tier lists. All of these are mostly cow derivative milk sources so Lactose Intolerant and Milk allergy people may not find this as helpful.

Greek_Yogurt.name: Greek_Yogurt
Greek_Yogurt.Bio:
- Top Tier
- Very high in protein per calorie
- Yogurt with fat: rumminant trans fat
- Vitamin B12: Maintains Blood and nerve cells
- Vitamin B2: Red Blood cell production
- Phosphorus: Cell and tissue maintenance
- Selenium: Antioxidant used to make DNA
- Rich in probiotics: Immune health and digestive health
- Shown to lower blood pressure
- Yogurt can be one of the biggest trap foods with blended, fruit at the bottom and some labled as Greek Yogurt contain added sugar.
- Check the nutrition label as there can exist ice cream levels amount of sugar.

Eggnog.name: Eggnog
Eggnog.Bio:
- C Tier
- Heavy Whipping Cream, Milk, Sugar, Eggs and Occasionally Alcoholic Beverages
- Choline: Neurotransmitter Synthesis
- Traditionally contains alcohol and added sugar.

Kefir.name: Kefir
Kefir.Bio:
- A Tier
- Most kefir drinks are low fat
- Solid source of protein per calorie
- Vitamin A: Eye Health and preservation
- Phosphorus: Cell and tissue maintenance
- Calcium: Strengthens bones and teeth
- Vitamin B12: maintains blood and nerve cells
- Very powerful probiotic: Aiding digestion and possibly mental health
- Shown to have antibacterial properties
- Can be a bit sugary, may contain added sugars
- Possible to consume too much probiotics.

Milk.name: Milk
Milk.Bio:
- A Tier
- 1 cup = 8 Fl. Oz. = 230 g
- Lower calorie source of protein
- Varying fat content
- Whole milk 3.25%, RF 2%, LF 1%, Skim 0%
- SF 70%, Mono 25%, 5% Poly
- Contains Ruminant Trans Fats: CLA natural fat loss aid
- Vitamin B12: Maintains Blood and nerve cells
- Vitamin-B2: Red Blood cell production
- Phosphorus: Cell and tissue maintenance
- Calcium: Strengthens bones and teeth
- Vitamin D: Helps absorb calcium and phosphorus
- Not for lactose intolerant people pr with milk allergies.

Cheddar_Cheese.name: Cheddar_Cheese
Cheddar_Cheese.Bio:
- B Tier
- Slice of cheese: 20g
- A lot higher calorie due to the abscence of water
- Very protein and fat dense per calorie
- Calcium: Bone health
- Phosphorus: Cell and tissue maintenance
- Selenium: Antioxidant, used to make DNA
- Vitamin-B12: Maintains Blood and nerve cells
- Vitamin-A: Eye Health and preservation
- Vitamin B2: Red Blood cell production
- Zinc: Cell growth and healing
- Vitamin K2: Healthy skin and bones
- Conjugated Linoleic Acid: Fat loss aid.
- Fermented: Anti-Inflammatory
- Very sodium and calroically dense

Butter.name: Butter
Butter.Bio:
- A Tier
- Very high in saturated fat 2:1 -> SF:USF
- Do still raise LDL cholesterol 
- Saturated fats raise less determental LDL particals
- Much more neutral effect on heart health
- Butyric Acid: Short Chain FAshown to: reduce intenstinal inflammation, Aid in treating IBSl and improve insuline Sensitivity
- Grass fed butter: more nutritious: More CLA, Omega 3, Micronutrients and antioxidants
- Vitamin A: Eye health and preservation
- More helpful for lactose intolerance.

Custard.name: Custard
Custard.Bio:
- C Tier
- Egg, Dairy and some kind of thickener.
- Phosphorus: Cell and Tissue Maintenance
- Vitamin B12: Maintains blood and nerve cells
- Vitamin B2: Red Blood cell production
- Vitamin B5: Break down of fat and carbs
- Lower in protein
- Often contains preservatives and added sugar

Cottage_Cheese.name: Cottage_Cheese
Cottage_Cheese.Bio:
- Top Tier
- Lower calorie than other cheeses
- Acidic being made from curds. 
- Vitamin B12: Maintains vlood and nerve cells
- Very high in protein to calorie
- Very filling: great for weight loss
- Solid source of dairy micros
- Pretty inexpensive

Frozen_Yogurt.name: Frozen_Yogurt
Frozen_Yogurt.Bio:
- D Tier
- Made with milk not cream
- Often contains gut beneficial probiotics
- Mild source of Phosphorus, calcium and B vitamins
- Usually contains added sugars, flavorings, and preservatives.

Half_and_half.name: Half_and_half
Half_and_half.Bio:
- B Tier
- Equal parts cream and milk
- Under 18% Fat (11-17%)
- Mild source of Dairy Micros

Ghee.name: Ghee
Ghee.Bio:
- Top Tier
- Clarified Butter
- Mainly Heart Neutral Saturated Fats
- Butytic Acid: Reduces Inflammation, treats IBS, improves insulin sensitivity
- Higher in Vitamin A: Eye Health and preservation
- Conjugaetd Linoleic Acid: Fat Loss, anticancer
- Has a higher smoking point.

Sour_Cream.name: Sour_Cream
Sour_Cream.Bio:
- C Tier
- Roughly 18% Fat.
- Contains Probiotics but in limited amounts due to pasteurization
- Low in protein compared to most dairy products.

Cream.name: Cream
Cream.Bio:
- B Tier
- Heavy Whipping Cream: >36% Fat
- Light Whipping Cream: 30-35% Fat
- Light Cram 18-30%
- Vitamin-A: Eye Health and Preservation
- Higher in Calories

Mozzarella_Cheese.name: Mozzarella_Cheese
Mozzarella_Cheese.Bio:
- B Tier
- Lower calorie than most cheeses
- Lower in fat, higher in protein
- Calcium: Strengthens bones and teeth
- Phosphorus: Cell and tissue maintenance
- Vitamin A: Eye Health and Preservation
- Vitamin B12: Maintains Blood and Nerve Cells
- Selenium: Antioxidant, used to make DNA
- Zinc: Cell growth and healing
- Vitamin B2: Red blood cells production
- Fermented: Anti-inflammatory
- Probiotic: Improves gut health and immune health
- Higher Sodium and calories

Buttermilk.name: Buttermilk
Buttermilk.Bio:
- A Tier
- Liquid leftover from churning butter
- Fermented and cultured adding healthy bacteria
- Probiotic: Benefits gut health aiding digestion
- Fermented Dairy Combats: Periodontitis: Oral inflamaiton from bacteria
- Calcium: Strengthens bones and teeth.
- Phosphorus: Cell and Tissue maintenance
- Vitamin D: Helps absorb calcium and phosphorus
- Higher in sugar and sodium per calorie.

Cream_Cheese.name: Cream_Cheese
Cream_Cheese.Bio:
- C Tier
- Typically 33-55% Fat
- Always Pasteurized
- Slightly Acidic
- Probiotic: Shown to Benefit gut health
- Vitamin-A: Eye Health and preservation
- Lower in protein per calorie

Ice_Cream.name: Ice_Cream
Ice_Cream.Bio:
- F Tier
- Made with Cream instead of Milk, typically a bit fattier
- Mild source of dairy micronutrients
- More caloric from fat and added sugar.
- Usually contain artificial flavors and additives
- Associates with cancers and intenstinal issues.
